content.description: Substance Concentration <math alttext="molar" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> <math alttext="X 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.10 <math alttext="Y 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.30 <math alttext="X Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.20 <math alttext="X 2 gas plus Y 2 gas is in equilibrium with 2 X Y gas; K sub c equals 25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mo>⇄</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>X</mtext><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.7em"></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.7em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The chemical reaction shown above took place inside a rigid container at constant temperature. The table provides the concentrations of reactants and products at some point during the reaction. Based on this information, which of the following explains whether or not the reaction has reached equilibrium, and why?

choices.label: The reaction is not at equilibrium because <math alttext="Q sub c is greater than K sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>; the forward reaction is favored in order to form more <math alttext="X Y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The reaction is not at equilibrium because <math alttext="Q sub c is less than K sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>; the reverse reaction is favored in order to form more <math alttext="X 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The reaction is not at equilibrium because <math alttext="Q sub c is less than K sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>; the forward reaction is favored in order to form more <math alttext="X Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The reaction is at equilibrium because <math alttext="Q sub c equals K sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>; the amount of <math alttext="X 2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>X</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, <math alttext="Y 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="X Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> will remain the constant.

content.answer: The reaction is not at equilibrium because <math alttext="Q sub c is less than K sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>; the forward reaction is favored in order to form more <math alttext="X Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 7.10: Reaction Quotient and Le Châtelier's Principle

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
